profile.title: AI Engineer
profile.summary: AI Engineer experienced in deploying AI models from research to production environments. Skilled in LLMs, RAG, agentic AI, and MLOps to design end-to-end intelligent systems using modern frameworks. Driven to build scalable, data-driven solutions with measurable real-world impact.

education.degree: Master’s in Data Science (Dual Degree Program)

education.institution: Higher School of Communication of Tunis (Sup’Com)

education.distinction: Ranked among the top 5% in the national engineering competition

responsibilities: Developing an agentic AI solution for predictive maintenance and anomaly detection within 5G O-RAN systems
Building an end-to-end data pipeline for training and real-time inference integrated with a Kubernetes cluster
Fine-tuning and deploying deep learning models (Transformers, LSTM) for anomaly detection, forecasting, and explainability
Designing and integrating AI agents using the A2A protocol for autonomous coordination and explainable decision-making
Integrating all components into the MX-AI platform as the primary end-to-end developer
Developed an LLM-based evaluation pipeline using zero-shot and few-shot prompt engineering
Worked with open-weight models such as LLaMA and Mistral to assess Wikidata reference reliability
Benchmarked model-human agreement and automated evaluations using LangChain
Built an end-to-end deep learning pipeline for mammogram tumor segmentation and classification
Applied transfer learning techniques for medical imaging tasks
Deployed the solution on AWS using Streamlit
Integrated CI/CD for automated retraining and model drift detection
Worked on an AI-driven air conditioner optimization project using machine learning techniques
Performed data engineering and preprocessing to extract features from sensor data
Designed and implemented data visualizations to analyze system behavior and usage patterns
Applied K-Means clustering to categorize sensor data and enable cluster-based predictions
Contributed to improving system performance and energy efficiency through data-driven optimization

projects.name: Agentic AI for 5G O-RAN Predictive Maintenance
description: Designed and implemented an agentic AI system for anomaly detection and predictive maintenance in 5G O-RAN environments
Built an end-to-end data pipeline for model training and real-time inference integrated with a Kubernetes cluster
Fine-tuned deep learning models (Transformers, LSTM) for anomaly detection, forecasting, and explainability
Implemented autonomous AI agents using the A2A protocol for coordinated and explainable decision-making
Integrated the full solution into the MX-AI platform as the primary end-to-end developer

projects.name: LLM-Based Evaluation of Wikidata Reference Reliability
description: Developed an LLM-based evaluation pipeline to assess the reliability of Wikidata references
Applied zero-shot and few-shot prompt engineering techniques to benchmark model performance
Evaluated agreement between LLM predictions and human annotations
Automated evaluation workflows using LangChain

projects.name: Mammogram Tumor Segmentation and Classification System
description: Built an end-to-end deep learning pipeline for mammogram tumor segmentation and classification
Applied transfer learning techniques to improve performance on medical imaging data
Deployed the solution on AWS using Streamlit for interactive visualization
Integrated CI/CD pipelines for automated retraining and model drift detection

projects.name: Automation and RAG-based TinyML Code Tool
description: Developed an LLM-driven automation pipeline for TinyML code generation and validation
Integrated Retrieval-Augmented Generation for context-aware embedded code generation
Designed a retrieval layer using FAISS and LangChain

projects.name: FMCW Radar-Based Gesture Detection
description: Built an end-to-end CNN pipeline for gesture recognition using 2D and 3D radar data
Achieved 88% classification accuracy
Implemented preprocessing and data augmentation pipelines for improved generalization

projects.name: AI-Driven Air Conditioner Optimization
description: Developed a machine learning-based system to predict optimal air conditioner settings and temperature values
Processed and engineered sensor data to build meaningful feature representations
Used K-Means clustering to group operating conditions and improve prediction accuracy
Created insightful visualizations to support analysis and decision-making
Focused on improving energy efficiency and system performance through data-driven optimization

journey.title: Mahdia, Tunisia — Where It Started
journey.subtitle: Tunisian Riviera
journey.description: I grew up in Mahdia, a coastal city on the Tunisian Riviera, next to the Mediterranean Sea. As a student, I was always fascinated by how things worked and driven by a strong ambition to become an engineer. This environment shaped my curiosity, discipline, and long-term vision of building a successful engineering career.
journey.highlight: Early passion for engineering and long-term ambition

journey.title: Monastir — Building Strong Foundations
journey.subtitle: Pre-Engineering Studies
journey.description: I moved to Monastir to pursue pre-engineering studies focused on mathematics and physics. During this period, I began deeply engaging with analytical thinking, problem solving, and technical reasoning. I worked on complex mathematical and technological problems that laid the foundation for my engineering mindset and prepared me for high-level competitive examinations.
journey.highlight: Top 5% in the national engineering entrance examination

journey.title: Sup’Com — Entering the World of Engineering
journey.subtitle: ICT Engineering (Telecommunications)
journey.description: I joined the Higher School of Communication of Tunis (Sup’Com), one of the most prestigious engineering schools in Tunisia, to pursue a Bachelor’s degree in Telecommunications and ICT engineering. There, I developed a strong foundation in computer systems, networks, wireless communications, and large-scale technological systems, while continuously ranking among the best students.
journey.highlight: Ranked among top students and selected for international dual-degree mobility

journey.title: EURECOM — From Engineering to AI
journey.subtitle: Master’s in Data Science (Dual Degree)
journey.description: I joined EURECOM on the French Riviera to strengthen my expertise in computer science, artificial intelligence, and data science. This step allowed me to combine my engineering background with advanced AI, machine learning, and systems knowledge, positioning me as a dual-degree graduate with a strong balance between theory, research, and real-world engineering applications.
journey.highlight: Dual-degree graduate with strong AI and computer science foundations
